abstract: France will continue to use data taken from HSBC’s private banking arm in Geneva in its drive against tax evasion, its budget minister said on Tuesday, a day after French officials agreed to share the client lists with Switzerland.
snippet: France will continue to use data taken from HSBC’s private banking arm in Geneva in its drive against tax evasion, its budget minister said on Tuesday, a day after French officials agreed to share the client lists with Switzerland.
lead_paragraph: France will continue to use data taken from a Geneva private bank in its drive against tax evasion, its budget minister said on Tuesday, a day after French officials agreed to share the client lists with Switzerland.

headline.main: France Will Use Swiss Bank Data in Investigation
